articles.title: How Scout24 is building the next generation of real-estate search with AI
articles.summary: Scout24 is revolutionizing real-estate search with AI-powered technology, enabling users to find their dream homes more efficiently. The platform utilizes machine learning algorithms to provide personalized property recommendations, streamlining the search process. By leveraging AI, Scout24 aims to transform the real-estate industry with a more intuitive and user-friendly search experience.

articles.title: OpenAI co-founds Agentic AI Foundation, donates AGENTS.md
articles.summary: OpenAI has co-founded the Agentic AI Foundation, a new organization focused on developing and promoting autonomous AI systems. As part of this effort, OpenAI has donated its AGENTS.md framework, an open-source toolkit for building and testing AI agents. This move aims to accelerate the development of more advanced and autonomous AI capabilities, with potential applications in areas like robotics and decision-making systems.

articles.title: Launching our first OpenAI Certifications courses
articles.summary: OpenAI has introduced its first certification courses, providing developers and professionals with official training and recognition in AI development and implementation. These courses aim to equip learners with the skills to effectively utilize OpenAI's technologies and tools. By offering these certifications, OpenAI is setting a new standard for AI expertise and education in the industry.

articles.title: Bringing powerful AI to millions across Europe with Deutsche Telekom
articles.summary: Deutsche Telekom is partnering to bring powerful AI capabilities to millions of customers across Europe, enhancing their digital experiences. This collaboration aims to democratize access to AI technology, making it more widely available and user-friendly. By doing so, it is expected to drive innovation and transform various aspects of daily life for Europeans.

articles.title: OpenAI appoints Denise Dresser as Chief Revenue Officer
articles.summary: OpenAI has appointed Denise Dresser as its new Chief Revenue Officer, marking a significant move to drive business growth and revenue strategies. This appointment is expected to help OpenAI expand its market presence and capitalize on the increasing demand for AI solutions. As CRO, Dresser will play a key role in shaping the company's commercial vision and scaling its operations.

articles.title: Engineering more resilient crops for a warming climate
articles.summary: Scientists are developing more resilient crops to withstand the challenges of a warming climate, using innovative engineering techniques to enhance their ability to thrive in extreme temperatures and weather conditions. This breakthrough has the potential to improve global food security and reduce crop losses due to climate-related stress. By creating climate-resilient crops, researchers aim to ensure a more sustainable food supply for future generations.

articles.title: AlphaFold: Five years of impact
articles.summary: AlphaFold, a revolutionary AI-powered protein structure prediction tool, has made significant impact over the past five years, transforming the field of biology and medicine. Its ability to accurately predict 3D protein structures has accelerated scientific discoveries, enabling breakthroughs in disease research and drug development. By democratizing access to protein structure prediction, AlphaFold has opened up new avenues for researchers and scientists worldwide.

articles.title: Revealing a key protein behind heart disease
articles.summary: Researchers have identified a key protein that plays a crucial role in the development of heart disease, paving the way for potential new treatments. This breakthrough discovery sheds light on the underlying mechanisms of cardiovascular disease, which is a leading cause of death worldwide. By targeting this protein, scientists may be able to develop more effective therapies to prevent and manage heart disease.

articles.title: How we’re bringing AI image verification to the Gemini app
articles.summary: Gemini is integrating AI-powered image verification into its app, enabling users to authenticate the legitimacy of images and combat deepfakes. This innovative feature utilizes machine learning algorithms to detect and flag manipulated or fake images, enhancing user trust and safety. By introducing this technology, Gemini aims to stay ahead of emerging threats and provide a more secure experience for its users.

articles.title: Build with Nano Banana Pro, our Gemini 3 Pro Image model
articles.summary: Introducing the Nano Banana Pro, a cutting-edge image model based on the Gemini 3 Pro, allowing developers to build innovative applications with enhanced visual capabilities. This model enables the creation of more realistic and detailed images, opening up new possibilities for AI-generated content. With Nano Banana Pro, developers can unlock new levels of creativity and precision in their projects.

articles.title: Apriel-1.6-15b-Thinker: Cost-efficient Frontier Multimodal Performance
articles.summary: Researchers have introduced Apriel-1.6-15b-Thinker, a cost-efficient AI model that achieves frontier multimodal performance, enabling efficient processing of various data types such as text, images, and audio. This innovation has the potential to improve applications like chatbots, virtual assistants, and content generation. By reducing computational costs, Apriel-1.6-15b-Thinker makes multimodal AI more accessible and affordable for widespread adoption.

articles.title: Introducing swift-huggingface: The Complete Swift Client for Hugging Face
articles.summary: The Hugging Face team has introduced swift-huggingface, a comprehensive Swift client that enables seamless integration with their popular AI model hub. This new client allows developers to easily access and utilize Hugging Face's vast library of models in their Swift-based projects, streamlining AI-powered app development. By bridging the gap between Swift and Hugging Face, developers can now leverage cutting-edge AI capabilities in their iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS applications.

articles.title: DeepMath: A lightweight math reasoning Agent with smolagents
articles.summary: Researchers have introduced DeepMath, a novel math reasoning agent that utilizes smolagents, a lightweight and efficient framework, to solve mathematical problems with improved accuracy and speed. This innovation has the potential to revolutionize math education and problem-solving, making it more accessible and efficient. By leveraging smolagents, DeepMath achieves state-of-the-art results while requiring significantly less computational resources.

articles.title: We Got Claude to Fine-Tune an Open Source LLM
articles.summary: Researchers fine-tuned Claude, an open-source large language model (LLM), to improve its performance and capabilities, making it a more viable alternative to proprietary models. This development has the potential to increase accessibility and innovation in the field of natural language processing. By fine-tuning Claude, the team demonstrated the model's ability to learn and adapt to specific tasks and datasets.

articles.title: Custom Policy Enforcement with Reasoning: Faster, Safer AI Applications
articles.summary: Researchers have introduced a new approach to custom policy enforcement with reasoning, enabling faster and safer AI applications by streamlining decision-making processes. This innovation allows AI systems to adapt to complex policies and regulations, reducing errors and improving overall performance. By integrating reasoning capabilities, AI applications can now make more informed decisions, leading to increased efficiency and reliability.

articles.title: Pebble Index 01 – External memory for your brain
articles.summary: The Pebble Index 01 is a innovative device that acts as an external memory aid, allowing users to store and recall information using a small, wearable device. This cutting-edge technology has the potential to revolutionize the way we manage information and memories, freeing up mental space for more creative and critical thinking. By augmenting human memory, the Pebble Index 01 could have a significant impact on productivity, learning, and overall cognitive function.

articles.title: Donating the Model Context Protocol and establishing the Agentic AI Foundation
articles.summary: The Model Context Protocol, a framework for building more transparent and explainable AI models, has been donated to the newly established Agentic AI Foundation. This move aims to accelerate the development of more accountable AI systems, enabling better understanding and control of AI decision-making processes. By making the protocol openly available, the foundation seeks to foster a community-driven approach to creating more trustworthy AI.

articles.title: Agentic AI Foundation
articles.summary: The Agentic AI Foundation is a new non-profit organization focused on developing and promoting AI systems that prioritize human well-being and agency. This initiative aims to create AI that aligns with human values and promotes a more equitable and transparent tech ecosystem. By prioritizing human-centered AI, the foundation seeks to mitigate the risks associated with advanced AI systems and ensure a more beneficial future for society.

articles.title: LLM from scratch, part 28 – training a base model from scratch on an RTX 3090
articles.summary: A developer has successfully trained a large language model (LLM) from scratch on a single NVIDIA RTX 3090 graphics card, a significant achievement in AI research. This feat demonstrates the feasibility of training complex models on consumer-grade hardware, potentially democratizing access to AI development. The project showcases the capabilities of modern GPUs and the determination of independent researchers in advancing AI technology.

articles.title: OpenEvolve: Teaching LLMs to Discover Algorithms Through Evolution
articles.summary: Researchers have introduced OpenEvolve, a novel approach that enables Large Language Models (LLMs) to discover algorithms through an evolutionary process, mimicking natural selection to optimize problem-solving. This innovation has the potential to significantly improve the efficiency and effectiveness of LLMs in tasks such as coding and problem-solving. By leveraging evolution, OpenEvolve allows LLMs to learn and adapt in a more human-like way, opening up new possibilities for AI development.

articles.title: Kaiju – General purpose 3D/2D game engine in Go and Vulkan with built in editor
articles.summary: Kaiju is a new, open-source game engine built with Go and Vulkan, offering a general-purpose platform for creating 2D and 3D games. What sets it apart is its built-in editor, making it a self-contained solution for game development. This innovative engine has the potential to simplify game creation and make it more accessible to developers.

articles.title: Apple's slow AI pace becomes a strength as market grows weary of spending
articles.summary: Apple's cautious approach to AI development is now being seen as a strategic advantage, as the market becomes increasingly wary of excessive spending on unproven AI technologies. This restraint allows Apple to focus on refining its existing AI capabilities, potentially leading to more practical and user-friendly applications. As a result, Apple's slow and steady approach may ultimately pay off in the rapidly evolving AI landscape.
